snippet: Gov. Rick Snyder of Michigan announced on Friday that the city of Detroit is so snarled in financial woes that the state must appoint an emergency manager to lead it out of disaster.
abstract: Gov Rick Snyder of Michigan announces state must appoint an emergency manager to lead Detroit out of financial disaster; manager would wield sweeping powers to reshape city, which is mired in more than $14 billion in long-term liabilities and annual worries of cash shortfalls.

byline.contributor: Mary Williams Walsh contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Gov. Rick Snyder of Michigan announced on Friday that the city of Detroit is so snarled in financial woes that the state must appoint an emergency manager to lead it out of disaster.

headline.seo: Michigan to Appoint Emergency Manager for Detroit
headline.main: Michigan Naming Fiscal Manager to Help Detroit
headline.print_headline: Michigan Naming Fiscal Manager To Help Detroit
